title: Help please
content:
Hi, I’m new here and to fonts in general. I’m having a really hard time identifying this font. It’s similar to Exocet, but I’m really hoping for a closer match. Any help would be appreciated. Also, any other font matching websites I should be aware of? I’ve used whatthefont and identifont with no luck. Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080110171721im_/http:/typophile.com/files/46251e4ed0c9cc2209e74e1eb6a907e0_15567_5757.jpg)

 [‹ DeLonghi logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080110171721/http:/typophile.com/node/40726 "Go to previous forum topic") [slight-serif block - Mt. Baker ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080110171721/http:/typophile.com/node/40715 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dantheman

comments.content: that \*is\* excocet, it’s just squashed and blurred all to hell.

Thank you for responding.  
I’m pretty sure that it’s actually not Exocet, there are many small differences:  
I not sure if I have all the terminology right, but:  
The W in Exocet has horizontal ends to the terminals.  
The middle bar of the E is shorter than in Exocet.  
The ends of the C are vertical in Exocet.  
The serifs are quite different on many of the letters.

Do you think it is a modified version of Exocet? If so, is there software I could use to try to attempt to duplicate it? I’d hate to have to photoshop everything, there’s a lot more text to it than just this. I really need a nearly identical font for the application I’m working on.  
Any other ideas?
This is a derivative version of Exocet. Support Emigre and license it from the original source.
Do you think that W is custom drawn maybe?
